title: Anchor-Based Transcript Sync (replace per-scroll server roundtrip)
description:
## Problem

Transcript-terminal scroll sync currently fires a server roundtrip on every scroll event. The handle_event("terminal_scrolled") in session_live.ex (line 164) receives visible_text from the JS hook, splits it into lines, trims each one, and does a linear substring search across all rendered_lines via find_matching_message/2 (line 264) and match_line_to_message/2 (line 272). This is fragile in three ways: (1) it sends up to ~80 lines of terminal text over the WebSocket on every 300ms debounce tick, (2) String.contains?/2 matching produces false positives when short common strings appear in multiple messages, and (3) the search is O(visible_lines * rendered_lines) per scroll event with no caching.

## Solution

Replace the per-scroll server roundtrip with a precomputed breakpoint map. On mount, the backend walks rendered transcript lines top-to-bottom consuming matches from the terminal buffer, finds anchor points where transcript content can be reliably identified in the terminal output, interpolates between anchors to cover gaps, and produces a breakpoint map: a sorted list of %{t: terminal_line, id: message_id}. This map is pushed to the JS client once. The client then does instant local binary search on scroll — no server call needed.

The algorithm:
1. Strip ANSI codes and trailing spaces from terminal capture, split into lines.
2. Walk rendered_lines top-to-bottom.
3. For each rendered line, scan terminal_lines forward from a cursor position (max 50 lookahead).
4. Match strategies by type priority: tool_use prefix match, user prompt text (>10 chars substring), tool result prefix match, assistant text (>30 chars substring).
5. On match: record anchor, advance cursor past match.
6. Between consecutive anchors: interpolate breakpoints proportionally to fill gaps.
7. Emit final breakpoint_map containing only entries where message_id changes.

## Acceptance Tests

- GIVEN the tool_heavy.jsonl fixture WHEN TranscriptSync.build_breakpoint_map/2 runs THEN at least 3 anchors are found AND the breakpoint_map covers terminal lines from first anchor to last anchor AND every message_id in the map exists in the rendered_lines
- GIVEN a breakpoint_map pushed to the client WHEN the user scrolls the terminal THEN the transcript panel highlights the correct message within 16ms (single frame) with zero server roundtrips
- GIVEN no terminal content (pane_id is nil) WHEN mount runs THEN breakpoint_map is assigned as [] and no errors occur
- GIVEN a breakpoint_map WHEN the user scrolls to a terminal line between two anchors THEN the interpolated message_id is the message that owns the proportional range between those anchors

## Rabbit Holes

- Perfect per-character fidelity in matching — approximate substring matching is fine
- Bidirectional sync (click transcript to scroll terminal) — out of scope
- Re-computing breakpoint map on live terminal output changes — defer, only compute on mount
- Handling tmux pane resize mid-session — defer

## No-gos

- No changes to TranscriptRenderer — consume its output as-is
- No changes to the terminal channel or tmux capture logic
- No persistent storage of breakpoint maps (computed in-memory only)
- No removal of the existing terminal_scrolled event handler — keep as fallback until proven stable

---
Rig: spotter. Appetite: reviewed.
Target: lib/spotter/services/ + lib/spotter_web/live/ + assets/js/.
Architecture: Ash/Phoenix/LiveView/xterm.js. Pure functions for sync algorithm, push_event for client delivery, binary search in JS.
Sources: lib/spotter/services/transcript_renderer.ex, lib/spotter_web/live/session_live.ex, assets/js/app.js, lib/spotter/services/tmux.ex, lib/spotter/services/tmux_output.ex.

title: Build TranscriptSync module with anchor-consume algorithm
description:
Create a pure-function module Spotter.Services.TranscriptSync that takes rendered transcript lines and stripped terminal lines, walks them with a forward-only consume cursor, finds anchor points, interpolates gaps, and emits a breakpoint map. This is the core algorithm with no LiveView or JS dependencies — independently testable against fixtures.

**Output files:**
- lib/spotter/services/transcript_sync.ex (new)
- test/spotter/services/transcript_sync_test.exs (new)

**Technical specs:**

Module: Spotter.Services.TranscriptSync

Public functions:

`build_breakpoint_map(rendered_lines, terminal_capture)` — Takes rendered_lines (output of TranscriptRenderer.render/1 — list of %{line, message_id, type, line_number}) and raw terminal_capture string. Returns sorted list of %{t: integer, id: String.t()} where t is 0-based terminal line index and id is message_id. Only boundary transitions included.

`find_anchors(rendered_lines, terminal_lines)` — Takes rendered_lines and pre-cleaned terminal_lines (list of strings). Returns sorted list of %{t: integer, tl: integer, id: String.t(), type: atom}. t = 0-based terminal line, tl = 1-based transcript line_number, type = :tool_use | :user | :result | :text.

`interpolate(anchors, total_terminal_lines)` — Takes sorted anchors and total line count. Fills gaps proportionally. Returns deduplicated breakpoint list.

`prepare_terminal_lines(terminal_capture)` — Strips ANSI via TranscriptRenderer.strip_ansi/1, strips trailing spaces via TmuxOutput.strip_trailing_spaces/1, splits on "\n".

**Algorithm for find_anchors/2:**
cursor = 0, max_lookahead = 50. For each rendered_line: scan terminal_lines[cursor..cursor+49]. Try match strategies in priority:
1. :tool_use — type == :assistant, line starts with "●". Match: terminal line contains "●" and the tool name.
2. :user — type == :user, trimmed length > 10, not starting with "  ⎿". Match: terminal line contains first 40 chars trimmed.
3. :result — type == :user, starts with "  ⎿". Match: terminal line contains "⎿" and first 30 chars of content after "⎿".
4. :text — type == :assistant, trimmed length > 30. Match: terminal line contains first 30 chars trimmed.
On match: record anchor, cursor = t + 1. No match: skip, cursor unchanged.

**Algorithm for interpolate/2:**
For each consecutive anchor pair: distribute terminal lines proportionally among transcript lines between them, grouped by message_id. Before first anchor: assign first anchor's id. After last: assign last's id. Deduplicate consecutive same-id entries.

**Component usage:**
- import Spotter.Services.TranscriptRenderer, only: [strip_ansi: 1]
- alias Spotter.Services.TmuxOutput

**Source references:**
- lib/spotter/services/transcript_renderer.ex — strip_ansi/1 (line 55), render/1 format (lines 17-26), "●" prefix (line 101), "  ⎿  " prefix (line 121)
- lib/spotter/services/tmux_output.ex — strip_trailing_spaces/1 (line 110)
- test/fixtures/transcripts/tool_heavy.jsonl, short.jsonl — fixtures
- test/spotter/services/transcript_renderer_test.exs — test patterns

**Edge cases:**
- Empty rendered_lines or terminal_capture → return []
- No anchors found → return []
- Single anchor → [%{t: 0, id: anchor.id}]
- Whitespace-only rendered lines → skip matching
- Heavy ANSI in terminal → stripped before matching
- Duplicate tool names → cursor advance ensures each matches next occurrence
- Large sessions (>5000 lines) → O(n+m) via cursor advance

**Definition of Done:**
- All requirements implemented
- Tests cover: tool_heavy >=3 anchors, short >=1 anchor, empty inputs return [], breakpoint_map ids are subset of rendered_lines ids, map sorted by :t, no duplicate consecutive ids
- mix test, mix credo --strict pass

title: Integrate breakpoint map into SessionLive mount
description:
Wire TranscriptSync into SessionLive so the breakpoint map is computed on mount and pushed to the JS client via push_event. Keep existing terminal_scrolled handler as fallback.

**Output files:**
- lib/spotter_web/live/session_live.ex (modify)

**Technical specs:**

1. Add alias: `alias Spotter.Services.{SessionRegistry, Tmux, TranscriptRenderer, TranscriptSync}`

2. In mount/3, after load_transcript (line 22):
   `{breakpoint_map, anchors} = compute_sync_data(pane_id, rendered_lines)`
   Add to assigns: `breakpoint_map: breakpoint_map, anchors: anchors, show_debug: false`

3. New private functions:
   defp compute_sync_data(nil, _), do: {[], []}
   defp compute_sync_data(pane_id, rendered_lines) do
     case Tmux.capture_pane(pane_id) do
       {:ok, capture} ->
         terminal_lines = TranscriptSync.prepare_terminal_lines(capture)
         anchors = TranscriptSync.find_anchors(rendered_lines, terminal_lines)
         breakpoint_map = TranscriptSync.interpolate(anchors, length(terminal_lines))
         {breakpoint_map, anchors}
       {:error, _} -> {[], []}
     end
   end

4. Push to client (when connected? and breakpoint_map non-empty):
   push_event(socket, "breakpoint_map", %{entries: breakpoint_map})
   push_event(socket, "debug_anchors", %{anchors: anchors})

5. In handle_info(:check_pane) and handle_info({:session_registered}) — when pane_id becomes available, also compute and push sync data.

6. Keep handle_event("terminal_scrolled") with comment: # Legacy fallback — removed once breakpoint sync is stable
